intro: Tardavel marginata, commonly known as the margined tardavel, is a unique plant species characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology. It features elongated, narrow leaves with a prominent margin that is often lighter in color than the central portion. The plant exhibits a climbing habit, utilizing tendrils to support itself along structures. Tardavel marginata is typically found in moist, shaded environments, where it thrives in the understory of tropical forests.
